page.title: 15HOUSING IN BALLATER
page.content: During the reign of Victoria the village of Ballater acquired its regular pattern of streets and smart new villas in Scottish Baronial style and conversions of original thatched cottages. More recent additions have included small local authority housing schemes and some up-market private development. Many of the small traditional houses have become second homes for city dwellers or are let to visitors. Many of the Victorian mansion houses have been converted into hotels or old-folks homes. There has been some imaginative provision of sheltered housing for senior citizens by the District Council.Property prices are very high. Local residents are often unable to afford to buy their own homes and have to rely on public provision.
